module.name: Buttons
module.short: Contains types and classes used to implement specialized button classes

element.name: TButtonLayout
element.short: Enumerated type which defines the position for a glyph on a button.

descr.p: TButtonLayout is an enumerated type which contains constants that define the position for a glyph on a button. It is used to implement the Layout property in TBitBtn and TSpeedButton classes. It is also used to control the layout of images drawn in the columns for TGrid and TStringGrid.

element.name: TButtonLayout.blGlyphLeft
element.short: Image is drawn aligned to the left

element.name: TButtonLayout.blGlyphRight
element.short: Image is drawn aligned to the right

element.name: TButtonLayout.blGlyphTop
element.short: Image is drawn aligned to the top

element.name: TButtonLayout.blGlyphBottom
element.short: Image is drawn aligned to the bottom

element.name: TButtonState
element.short: A set of constants to define the state of a SpeedButton.

descr.p: TButtonState is an enumerated type with constants that define the drawing state for a button. TButtonState is the type used to implement the State property in TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: TButtonState.bsUp
element.short: Draw the button in its up state

element.name: TButtonState.bsDisabled
element.short: Draw the button in its disabled state

element.name: TButtonState.bsDown
element.short: Draw the button in its down state

element.name: TButtonState.bsExclusive
element.short: Draw the button as the only one down in its group

element.name: TNumGlyphs
element.short: Defines the range of values available to access button glyphs

descr.p: TNumGlyphs is an Integer range constant which defines the minimum and maximum number of glyphs available for buttons. TNumGlyphs is the type used to implement the NumGlyphs property in TButtonGlyph, TCustomBitBtn, and TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: TGlyphTransparencyMode
element.short: Enumerated type with transparency mode values for button glyphs
element.descr: TGlyphTransparencyMode is an enumerated type which contains values representing the transparency modes used for button glyphs. TGlyphTransparencyMode is the type used to implement the TransparentMode property in TButtonGlyph.

element.name: TGlyphTransparencyMode.gtmGlyph
element.short: Transparency is defined in the glyph

element.name: TGlyphTransparencyMode.gtmOpaque
element.short: Transparent is not used, as defined by the owner of the glyph

element.name: TGlyphTransparencyMode.gtmTransparent
element.short: Glyph is drawn with transparency

element.name: TButtonGlyph
element.short: Represents an image that can be attached to a button

descr.p: TButtonGlyph is a TObject descendant used to represent the image with the symbol or pictograph displayed on a button, or in a column in a grid. Use the properties and methods in the class to specify the image displayed in the glyph, and the display settings required for the image.

Images and ExternalImages are image lists with the content that can be displayed in the glyph. Glyph contains the bitmap, scaled to the necessary display density, used in the class instance. Width and Height represent the dimensions for the Glyph.
ShowMode determines when the image is displayed, just like its usage in TMenu and TMenuItem.
TransparentMode indicates whether the glyph image is drawn with transparency, as works in conjunction with the Transparent property in the parent control.

TButtonGlyph implements the IImageCacheListener interface used to provide support for cached images in TImageList. TButtonGlyph also implements the IUnknown interface to support the QueryInterface method and reference counting.
TButtonGlyph is the type used to implement the ButtonGlyph property in TCustomBitBtn and TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetHeight
element.short: Gets the value for the Height property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetHeight.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetNumGlyphs
element.short: Gets the value for the NumGlyphs property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetNumGlyphs.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the Width property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ExternalImageIndex property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImageIndex.AExternalImageIndex
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImages
element.short: Sets the value for the ExternalImages property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImages.AExternalImages
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImageWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ExternalImageWidth property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetExternalImageWidth.AExternalImageWidth
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetGlyph
element.short: Sets the value for the Glyph property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetGlyph.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetNumGlyphs
element.short: Sets the value for the NumGlyphs property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetNumGlyphs.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetShowMode
element.short: Sets the value for the ShowMode property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetShowMode.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ClearImages
element.short: Removes the references to Images for the button states
element.descr: ClearImages is a procedure used to remove index references to Images used for button states in the glyph. ClearImages sets the values in an internal member to -1 to indicate that the image for the corresponding TButtonState is not used.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ClearLCLGlyph
element.short: Removes the name for the LCL Glyph used in the class instance

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetLCLGlyphName
element.short: Sets the resource name for the LCL glyph used in the instance to the specified value

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetLCLGlyphName.ALCLGlyphName
element.short: LCL glyph resource name used to get images in the glyph

element.name: TButtonGlyph.QueryInterface
element.short: Implements the method from IUnknown

element.name: TButtonGlyph.QueryInterface.iid
element.short: Interface identifier for the specified object

element.name: TButtonGlyph.QueryInterface.obj
element.short: Object examined for the specified interface

element.name: TButtonGlyph._AddRef
element.short: Implements the method from IUnkown

element.name: TButtonGlyph._AddRef.Result
element.short: Always contains -1

element.name: TButtonGlyph._Release
element.short: Implements the method from IUnknown

element.name: TButtonGlyph._Release.Result
element.short: Always contains -1

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CacheSetImageList
element.short: Stores the specified Image list in the Images property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CacheSetImageList.AImageList
element.short: Image list stored to the Images property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CacheSetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the button state for the image in AIndex to the value specified in AImageIndex

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CacheSetImageIndex.AIndex
element.short: Position of the Button state applied to the specified image

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CacheSetImageIndex.AImageIndex
element.short: Position of the Image updated in the method

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CanShow
element.short: Indicates if the glyph can be drawn for the button glyph

descr.p: CanShow is a Boolean function which indicates if the glyph can be drawn for the button glyph. The return value is determined by examining the value in the ShowMode property. Values in the TGlyphShowMode enumeration determine the return value using the following logic:

dl.dd: Uses the Application.ShowButtonGlyphs property to determine the return value
Uses the value from SystemShowButtonGlyphs as the return value

descr.remark: Please note: The return value is always True at design-time.
descr.p: Use CanShowGlyph to determine if an image is available to be drawn on the button.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CanShow.Result
element.short: True when the glyph can be displayed on the button

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CanShowGlyph
element.short: Determines if an image is available for the button glyph

descr.p: CanShowGlyph is a Boolean function used to determine if an image is available for the button glyph. The return value is True when an image has been specified using one of the following mechanisms (in the order of precedence):

ul.li: Images is assigned and contains valid button state images
LCLGlyphName contains a non-empty resource name
ExternalImages is assigned and contains a valid ExternalImageIndex value

element.name: TButtonGlyph.CanShowGlyph.Result
element.short: True when a glyph image is available

element.name: TButtonGlyph.DoChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the glyph image has been changed for the class instance

descr.p: DoChange is a procedure used to performs actions needed when the glyph image has been changed for the class instance. DoChange signals the OnChange event handler (when assigned).

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GlyphChanged
element.short: Provides a default implementation for the OnChange event handler

descr.p: GlyphChanged is procedure which provides the default implementation for the OnChange event handler. Sender is the TObject instance for the change notification, and normally receives a reference to the current TButtonGlyph class instance.

GlyphChanged ensures that the internal ImagesCache member is set to Nil, and the ClearImages methods is called to remove images stored in the Images property. When CanShow returns True, the internal ImagesCache member is re-populated and registered to listen for changes to the Glyph property.
GlyphChanged is assigned to the OnChange event handler when the class instance is created, and when a bitmap is assigned to the Glyph property.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GlyphChanged.Sender
element.short: Button glyph for the change notification

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetTransparentMode
element.short: Sets the value for the TransparentMode property

descr.p: SetTransparentMode is a procedure used to set the value in the TransparentMode property to the specified TGlyphTransparencyMode value. SetTransparentMode ensures that the bitmap in the Glyph property is updated to use the same transparency mode.
descr.remark: Please note: SetTransparentMode is not the write access specifier for TransparentMode, which is a read-only property.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.SetTransparentMode.AValue
element.short: Value stored in the TransparentMode property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.TransparentMode
element.short: Indicates the transparency mode used to render the glyph image

descr.p: TransparentMode is a read-only TGlyphTransparencyMode property used to indicate the transparency mode applied when the glyph image is drawn.
Use SetTransparentMode to change the value for the property.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TButtonGlyph: frees the Images cache then creates a Glyph Bitmap

descr.p: If you drop a component on the form in the form editor, you don't need to add code to explicitly create it. The component is automatically created together with the the form, and destroyed when the form is destroyed.

However, if you create the component by code, don't forget to free it when it is no longer needed. Constructors allocate memory and system resources needed by the object. They also call the constructor for any sub-objects present in the class.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TButtonGlyph: frees caches and calls inherited Destroy

descr.p: If you call Destroy for an object which hasn't been initialized yet, it will generate an error. Always use the Free method to deallocate objects, because it verifies that the object does not contain the value Nil.
Take the following precautions when creating your own Destroy method:

ul.li: Declare Destroy with the override directive, because it is a virtual method.
Always call the inherited Destroy method as the last action in the destructor code.

An exception may be raised in the constructor if there is not enough memory to create an object, or something else goes wrong. If the exception is not handled inside the constructor, the object will be only partially built. In this case Destroy will be called, so your destructor must check if the resources were really allocated before the are released.
Remember to call Free for all objects created on the constructor.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.GetImageIndexAndEffect
element.short: Gets the index for a button image using a given state, and the effect used to draw it

descr.p: GetImageIndexAndEffect is a procedure used to get the ordinal position for the image used to render the Glyph for the class instance. In addition, it returns the image resolution for the specified display density and the drawing effect for the button State.
GetImageIndexAndEffect uses ThemeServiecs to determine if drawing effects are automatically applied to glyph images, and captures the effect in the AEffect output argument.

GetImageIndexAndEffect determines the image source and the ordinal position for the image used for the button glyph. ExternalImages and ExternalImageIndex are used (when assigned). The next available source is the resource name specified in LCLGlyphResourceName (when specified). Finally, the Images property is used (when assigned). When the image source has been determined, the correct image resolution for the value in APPI is selected and stored in AImageResolution. ImageIndexes is used to get the position for the image with the specified button State.
GetImageIndexAndEffect is used in in the implementation of the Draw method in TButtonGlyph, and in the GetGlyphSize method in TCustomSpeedButton.

notes.note: Not sure how to describe the purpose/use of CEffects in the method.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Draw
element.short: Draws the image in the specified rectangle, within the client rectangle at specified offset, with the specified state and transparency

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Refresh
element.short: Updates the button glyph after changes to property values

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Glyph
element.short: The bitmap image drawn as the glyph on the button

descr.p: Glyph is a TBitmap property with the bitmap image drawn as the glyph for the class instance. The value in Glyph is created/loaded when a bitmap is assigned directly to the property, or when loaded from a Lazarus resource or stock icon.

Assigning a new TBitmap value to Glyph causes the content in ExternalImages to be discarded. The GlyphChanged method is assigned to the OnChange event handler in the bitmap to track changes to the image. If the Bitmap contains multiple adjacent images (determined using Width and Height), the NumGlyphs property is updated to contain the number of glyphs stored in the bitmap. The Refresh method is called to update the button glyph following changes to its property values.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.IsDesigning
element.short: Indicates whether change notifications are suppressed while editing property values

descr.p: IsDesigning is a Boolean property which indicates whether change notifications are suppressed while editing property values for the button glyph. The default value for the property is False, as assigned in the Create constructor.

Set IsDesigning to True to prevent calls to the Refresh method following a change to the ShowMode property, or when getting/setting the image for the button Glyph. Controls which use TButtonGlyph, like TBitBtn and TSpeedButton, will update the property to indicate whether the ComponentState for the control includes the csDesigning enumeration value. This has the net effect of disabling OnChange notifications at design-time.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.NumGlyphs
element.short: The number of glyphs available for button states

descr.p: NumGlyphs is a TNumGlyphs property which indicates the number of glyphs available for its button states. The default value for the property is 1 (the low value for the range), and indicates that a single image is used for all button states in the TButtonGlyph.

The value in NumGlyphs is updated when a TBitmap instance is directly assigned to the Glyph property, and when GetImageIndexAndEffect retrieves the Images and drawing effect(s) for a given display density (PPI).

Reading the value in NumGlyphs causes the ExternalImages property to be examined; when it is assigned, the value for the property is always 1 (corresponding to the ExternalImageIndex). Otherwise, the value in the internal member is used.
Changing the value in NumGlyphs causes the Refresh method to be called.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Images
element.short: The list of available images for the button glyph

descr.p: Images is a read-only TCustomImageList property which contains the images available for the Glyph in the class instance.

Images is used in conjunction with the ExternalImages and LCLGlyphName properties. ExternalImages (when assigned) is used as the source for the Images in the class instance. The images with the resolution needed for the display density (PPI) are scaled to the ExternalImageWidth and stored in Images. LCLGlyphName (when assigned) is used to retrieve a resource in LCLGlyphs when ExternalImages are unassigned. Otherwise, existing items in Images are used.
See for more information about image retrieval for the button glyph.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.LCLGlyphName
element.short: Stores the standard LCL resource name used for the Glyph in the class instance

descr.p: LCLGlyphName is a String property used to store the name for the LCL resource used as the Glyph for the class instance. Changing the value in LCLGlyphName causes existing entries in Images and ExternalImages to be removed, and the OnChange event handler to be signalled. The Image lists are not modified when the property is set to an empty string ('').
LCLGlyphName normally contains a value like those in BitBtnResNames, and represents a standard resource name used in the LCL.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ExternalImages
element.short: Contains a reference to an existing list of images available for use in the Glyph property

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ExternalImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position in the external image list for the glyph image

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ExternalImageWidth
element.short: Width of an image in the external image list

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Width
element.short: The width of the glyph image

element.name: TButtonGlyph.Height
element.short: The height of the glyph image

element.name: TButtonGlyph.ShowMode
element.short: Indicates the logic used to display the Glyph image for the class instance

descr.p: ShowMode is a TGlyphShowMode property which indicates logic used to display the Glyph image for the class instance.

The default value for the property is gsmApplication, and indicates that ShowButtonGlyphs in TApplication determines the visibility of the button Glyph. See for more information about TGlyphShowMode enumeration values and their usage in TButtonGlyph.
Changing the value for the property causes the Refresh method to be called when IsDesigning contains False.

element.name: TButtonGlyph.OnChange
element.short: Event handler for a change in the glyph

descr.p: OnChange is a TNotifyEvent property that represents an event handler signalled when the image used in the Glyph property is altered. OnChange is signalled from the DoChange method, and occurs after Glyph has been loaded using resources or image lists available to the class instance.
TButtonGlyph provides a default implementation for the event handler in its GlyphChanged method.

element.name: TBitBtnKind
element.short: TBitBtnKind - enumerated type of possible kinds of BitButtons.

descr.p: TBitBtnKind - enumerated type of possible kinds of BitButtons. Values in TBitBtnKind are used to select the appropriate image displayed as the glyph for TBitBtn class instances. TBitBtnKind is the type used to implement the Kind property in TCustomBitBtn.

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkCustom
element.short: Uses a custom image assigned in the button

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkOK
element.short: Uses the OK button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkCancel
element.short: Uses the CANCEL button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkHelp
element.short: Uses the HELP button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkYes
element.short: Uses the YES button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkNo
element.short: Uses the NO button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkClose
element.short: Uses the CLOSE button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkAbort
element.short: Uses the ABORT button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkRetry
element.short: Uses the RETRY button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkIgnore
element.short: Uses the IGNORE button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkAll
element.short: Uses the ALL button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkNoToAll
element.short: Uses the NO TO ALL button image

element.name: TBitBtnKind.bkYesToAll
element.short: Uses the YES TO ALL button image

element.name: TBitBtnKinds
element.short: TBitBtnKinds - set of TBitBtnKind

notes.note: Not used internally, nor in any other units in LCL.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn
element.short: TCustomBitBtn - the ancestor class for TBitBtn

descr.p: TCustomBitBtn is a TCustomButton descendant, and the ancestor for TBitBtn. It provides the interface used to display a button with a glyph (or image) and a caption. It performs an action when the button is clicked.
If you want to define your own bitbutton class, you should derive it from this class.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetGlyph
element.short: Gets the value for the Glyph property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetGlyph.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetGlyphShowMode
element.short: Gets the value for the GlyphShowMode property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetGlyphShowMode.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetNumGlyphs
element.short: Gets the value for the NumGlyphs property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetNumGlyphs.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.ImageListChange
element.short: Perform a change notification when Images for the control are updated

descr.p: ImageListChange is a procedure used to perform a change notification when the Images for the control have been updated.

Sender is the TObject instance generating the change notification. ImageListChange compares Sender to the object in the Images property, and calls the GlyphChanged method when they are the same instance.
ImageListChange is assigned to the OnChange event handler in the internal TChangeLink member used in the class.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.ImageListChange.Sender
element.short: Object generating the change notification

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.IsGlyphStored
element.short: Gets the storage specifier for the Glyph property

descr.p: IsGlyphStored is a Boolean function used to get the storage specifier for the Glyph property. The return value is True when an image has not already been assigned in the Action property, or in the TButtonGlyph constructed for the control. This ensures that the image is included in processing that occurs for the LCL component streaming mechanism.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.IsGlyphStored.Result
element.short: True when the glyph image is stored in the LCL component stream

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetGlyph
element.short: Sets the value for the Glyph property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetGlyph.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetGlyphShowMode
element.short: Sets the value for the GlyphShowMode property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetGlyphShowMode.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetKind
element.short: Sets the value for the Kind property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetKind.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetLayout
element.short: Sets the value for the Layout property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetLayout.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetMargin
element.short: Sets the value for the Margin property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetMargin.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetNumGlyphs
element.short: Sets the value for the NumGlyphs property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetNumGlyphs.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetSpacing
element.short: Sets the value for the Spacing property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetSpacing.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

descr.p: RealizeKind is a procedure used to load and configure properties for the control. RealizeKind ensures that the Glyph displayed on the control contains a valid image for the value in the Kind property. When Kind contains bkCustom, it is assumed that the image was assigned directly to the Glyph property. For all other values, the following logic is used to derive the Glyph image:

ol.li: Call GetDefaultBitBtnGlyph to get a user-supplied bitmap for the glyph (when available).
Use ThemeServices to get a "stock" image supplied by the widget set (when available).
Use the graphic stored in Images at the position in ImageIndex (when assigned).
Load the Glyph image from a LCL resource for the specified Kind.

descr.p: ForceDefaults indicates if default values are applied to properties in the control. When it contains True, the following properties are updated:
RealizeKind is called when the value in the Kind property is changed, and when the control has been Loaded using the LCL component streaming mechanism.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.RealizeKind.ForceDefaults
element.short: True if the default values for properties are used in the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetCaptionOfKind
element.short: Gets the default value for the Caption used for the button Kind

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetCaptionOfKind.Result
element.short: Default value for the Caption property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetCaptionOfKind.AKind
element.short: Enumeration value that identifies the kind of BitButton

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImages
element.short: Gets the value for the Images property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImages.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImages
element.short: Sets the value for the Images property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImages.AImages
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageIndex property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImageIndex.AImageIndex
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImageWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageWidth property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GetImageWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImageWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageWidth property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.SetImageWidth.AImageWidth
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.FButtonGlyph
element.short: An internal member which contains the TButtonGlyph instance for the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.ActionChange
element.short: ActionChange - Changes the action associated with the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GlyphChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the value in Glyph has been changed

descr.p: Ensures that the widget set class is notified of a change in the value for the Glyph property. Calls InvalidatePreferredSize and AdjustSize to resize the control for the new Glyph image.
Assigned to the OnChange event handler in the TButtonGlyph instance for the control, and called directly from the ImageListChange method.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GlyphChanged.Sender
element.short: TObject instance for the change notification

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.IsCaptionStored
element.short: Gets the storage specifier for the Caption property

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.IsCaptionStored.Result
element.short: True when a value for the property is included in the LCL component streaming mechanism

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has been loaded using LCL component streaming

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Notification
element.short: Performs actions needed when a sub-component is added or removed in the class instance

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the notification message

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation performed for the notification message

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor, and initializes the layout, style, spacing, and Button Glyph for the control.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Click - the procedure which allows programmatic simulation of a mouse click, and thus activation of the Action associated with the OnClick event.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromResourceName
element.short: Loads the Glyph image with the specified named from a resource instance

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromResourceName.AName
element.short: Resource name for the image loaded in the method

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource
element.short: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource - method for loading the glyph from a Lazarus resource file (.lrs)

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource.AName
element.short: Name for the resource loaded from the Lazarus resource file

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromStock
element.short: Loads a stock glyph image for the specified button identifier

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.LoadGlyphFromStock.idButton
element.short: Button identifier used to determine the image loaded in the Glyph

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.CanShowGlyph
element.short: Indicates if the Glyph for the button can be displayed

descr.p: CanShowGlyph is a Boolean function which indicates if the Glyph for the button can be displayed. The return value contains the result from the CanShowGlyph method in the internal TButtonGlyph member.
AWithShowMode indicates whether the ShowMode property for the button glyph is examined in the method by calling the CanShow method in TButtonGlyph.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.CanShowGlyph.Result
element.short: True when the Glyph image can be displayed for the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.CanShowGlyph.AWithShowMode
element.short: Indicates if the ShowMode for the glyph is examined in the method

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Caption
element.short: Contains the descriptive text displayed for the Bitmap button control

descr.p: Caption is a public TCaption property which contains the descriptive text displayed for the Bitmap button control. Assign a value to Caption when the Kind property is set to bkCustom. When Kind contains one of the other TBtiBtnKind enumeration values, the Caption is normally set using the GetCaptionOfKind method.
Use DefaultCaption to determine if the value in Caption is the default one for the control.

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.DefaultCaption
element.short: Indicates if Caption contains a default value

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Glyph
element.short: Bitmap with the Glyph displayed on the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.NumGlyphs
element.short: The number of glyphs available for the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Images
element.short: Contains images available for the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the image displayed on the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.ImageWidth
element.short: Display width for the glyph image on the control

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Kind
element.short: What kind of BitButton? Custom, OK, Cancel, Yes, No etc

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Layout
element.short: Layout of button - Glyph at top, bottom, left or right

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Margin
element.short: The margin to be left around glyphs

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.Spacing
element.short: The spacing around the BitButton

element.name: TCustomBitBtn.GlyphShowMode
element.short: Indicates the policy for showing or hiding the glyph image of this button

element.name: TBitBtn
element.short: A Button with a small image attached
element.descr: Bit Button: a push button control on a toolbar causing a particular action to be executed. It often displays a glyph or small graphic to denote its function.

descr.p: Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
The (default) action to be associated with this control.
Can either read the action already associated with the control (GetAction), or write an action to be associated (SetAction).
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign).
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent control.
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determines the border spacing for this control.
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing.

Setting this property to true, will have the effect that when the user hits ESC this button is Clicked, even if the button does not have focus. Usually the Button which reacts to ESC sets the ModalResult of the form to mrCancel.
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecessary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.
Defines whether a button is the Default selection for a form. That is, pressing ENTER will execute its OnClick method, even when the control does not have focus!
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'.
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be specified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList.
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.
OnKeyDown - event handler for instance when key is down while control has focus
Differs from OnKeyPress in that the key may have already been down when the control received focus; with OnKeyPress the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus.
OnKeyPress - event controller for a key being pressed while the control has focus
Differs from OnKeyDown in that the key needs to become pressed while the control has focus; with OnKeyDown the key may have already been down when the control received focus.
OnKeyUp - event handler for instance when a key is up (not pressed) while the control has focus.
The key may already have been up when the control received focus, or a pressed key may become released during the time the control has focus.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants. Reads the details of the pop-up menu, or stores them. Properties are defined in the parent class TPopupMenu

Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants. Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint.

The Visible property indicates the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True, the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling the Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on the visibility of a parent control. Use IsVisible method to consider this, and get the real visibility for a control in its parent container.

element.name: TSpeedButtonActionLink
element.short: Links a TSpeedButton with a TAction instance

element.name: TSpeedButtonActionLink.SetGroupIndex
element.short: SetGroupIndex - stores the value of the index within the list of links

element.name: TSpeedButtonActionLink.SetChecked
element.short: SetChecked - stores the Checked status (True or False)

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton
element.short: The ancestor class for TSpeedButton

descr.p: TCustomSpeedButton is a TGraphicControl descendant, and the ancestor for TSpeedButton. If you want to define your own SpeedButton class, you should derive it from this class.

A SpeedButton is designed to automatically perform a process when it is depressed. The user can push the button to start an action or set a mode. When a user clicks on a SpeedButton focus is not shifted; a Speed Button never gets focus. The button may have a descriptive glyph (symbol or pictograph), and has a state (checked or unchecked).

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetGlyph
element.short: Gets the value for the Glyph property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetGlyph.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ImageListChange
element.short: Performs actions needed when the value in Images is changed

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.IsGlyphStored
element.short: Gets the storage specifier for the Glyph property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.IsGlyphStored.Result
element.short: True when a value for the Glyph property is included in the LCL component streaming mechanism

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetShowCaption
element.short: Sets the value for the ShowCaption property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetShowCaption.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.UpdateExclusive
element.short: Sends a message to the parent control when the value in AllowAllUp, GroupIndex, or Down is changed

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetAllowAllUp
element.short: Sets the value for the AllowAllUp property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetAllowAllUp.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetGlyph
element.short: Sets the value for the Glyph property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetGlyph.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetLayout
element.short: Sets the value for the Layout property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetLayout.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetShowAccelChar
element.short: Sets the value for the ShowAccelChar property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetShowAccelChar.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetTransparent
element.short: Sets the value for the Transparent property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetTransparent.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CMButtonPressed
element.short: Control message passed when the button is pressed

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CMEnabledChanged
element.short: Control message passed when the control is enabled

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.DoMouseUp
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Mouse Up message is received for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImages
element.short: Gets the value for the Images property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImages.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImages
element.short: Sets the value for the Images property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImages.AImages
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageIndex property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageIndex property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImageIndex.AImageIndex
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImageWidth
element.short: Gets the value for the ImageWidth property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetImageWidth.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImageWidth
element.short: Sets the value for the ImageWidth property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetImageWidth.AImageWidth
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.FState
element.short: Internal member used to store the TButtonState for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ButtonGlyph
element.short: Gets the TButtonGlyph used for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ButtonGlyph.Result
element.short: TButtonGlyph instance used for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetNumGlyphs
element.short: Gets the value for the NumGlyphs property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetNumGlyphs.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GlyphChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the value in the Glyph property has been changed

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GlyphChanged.Sender
element.short: TObject instance for the change notification

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CalculatePreferredSize
element.short: Calculates the default height and width required for the control

descr.p: Calls MeasureDraw to gets the values for the variable parameters in PreferredWidth and PreferredHeight.
descr.remark: Please note: The WithThemeSpace parameter is NOT used in the current implementation.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CalculatePreferredSize.PreferredWidth
element.short: Width calculated for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CalculatePreferredSize.PreferredHeight
element.short: Height calculated for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.CalculatePreferredSize.WithThemeSpace
element.short: Not used in the current implementation

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.MeasureDraw
element.short: Calculates the Width and Height for theSpeedButton, and optionally renders the control
element.descr: Used in the implementation of the CalculatePreferredSize and Paint methods.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Notification
element.short: Performs action needed when a sub-component is added or removed for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the notification message

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Notification.Operation
element.short: Action performed for the notification message

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.PaintBackground
element.short: Paints the background for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.PaintBackground.PaintRect
element.short: Rectangle where the control is drawn

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetDown
element.short: Sets the value for the Down property
element.descr: SetDown - specifies the Boolean value of Down (i.e. whether or not button was pressed)

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetDown.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetGroupIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the GroupIndex property
element.descr: SetGroupIndex - specifies the value of the Group Index.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetGroupIndex.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetFlat
element.short: Sets the value for the Flat property
element.descr: SetFlat - specifies whether or not the button is displayed Flat

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetFlat.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetMargin
element.short: Sets the value for the Margin property
element.descr: SetMargin - specifies the size of the margin

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetMargin.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetNumGlyphs
element.short: Sets the value for the NumGlyphs property
element.descr: SetNumGlyphs - specifies the number of glyphs.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetNumGlyphs.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetSpacing
element.short: Sets the value for the Spacing property
element.descr: SetSpacing - specifies the spacing between buttons.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.SetSpacing.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.RealSetText
element.descr: Used by SetTextBuf to store a text string rather than performing read/write using a PChar buffer

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.RealSetText.Value
element.short: Value stored in the method

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.UpdateState
element.short: Updates internal members used to track state changes in the control
element.descr: UpdateState - brings the state up to date, implementing any pending changes, and rendering non-valid if InvalidateOnChange is True

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.UpdateState.InvalidateOnChange
element.short: Indicates if the control is invalidated following a change in state

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetDrawDetails
element.short: GetDrawDetails - returns the structured details for drawing

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.MouseInControl
element.short: MouseInControl - returns True if the mouse cursor is in the control

descr.p: Loaded is called by the LCL streaming system when a root component was completely read from a stream and all properties and references to other objects have been resolved. Descendents of TComponent should override this method to perform additional processing when all published properties have been set from values obtained from the LCL component stream.
Application programmers should never call Loaded directly; this is done automatically by the LCL streaming system.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetGlyphSize
element.short: GetGlyphSize - returns the size of the glyph within the specified PaintRect

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GetTextSize
element.short: GetTextSize - returns the size of the text within the specified PaintRect

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.DrawGlyph
element.short: Draws the glyph on the specified canvas in the specified rectangle at a given offset within the client, with specified state and transparency

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomSpeedButton: calls inherited Create and initializes many defaults and properties

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomSpeedButton. It calls the inherited Create method and sets the default values for properties in the class instance. Among the properties set are Glyph, the initial bounds, control style, layout, color, caption and mouse responses.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TCustomSpeedButton: frees Glyph then calls inherited Destroy
element.descr: Destroy is the destructor for TCustomSpeedButton. It frees resources allocated to the Glyph property, and calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.FindDownButton
element.short: FindDownButton - returns the button that is down

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.LoadGlyphFromResourceName
element.short: Loads the image for the Glyph with the specified name from a resource instance

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource
element.short: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource - method for loading a glyph from a Lazarus Resource file (.lrs)

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.AllowAllUp
element.short: Boolean flag whichindicates if all buttons in a group are allowed to be Up (default is False)

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Down
element.short: Indicates if the button has been set to the Down state

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Flat
element.short: Whether the button is to be displayed Flat or in relief

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Glyph
element.short: The Bitmap used for the glyph image on the button

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.GroupIndex
element.short: The ordinal position for the control within a group of related speedbuttons

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Images
element.short: Contains images available for use as the glyph for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ImageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the Image used as the glyph for the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ImageWidth
element.short: Display width for the glyph image in the control

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Layout
element.short: The button layout - Glyph at top, bottom, left or right

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Margin
element.short: Margin - the space around glyph and caption
element.descr: A value of -1 centers the content. If Spacing is -1 too then there is the same space on the left, between the glyph and caption, and on the right.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.NumGlyphs
element.short: The number of Glyphs available

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ShowAccelChar
element.short: Indicates if the accelerator charactershould be shown (i.e. underlined character denoting key to be pressed for quick action)

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.ShowCaption
element.short: Indicates if the caption for the speed button is displayed

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Spacing
element.short: Spacing between Glyph and Caption
element.descr: If Spacing is -1 and Margin is -1 then Glyph and Caption are centered and there is the same amount of space between Glyph and Caption and on the left and right. If Spacing is -1 and Margin is not -1 then Spacing will fill the remaining space.

element.name: TCustomSpeedButton.Transparent
element.short: Indicates if the control is drawn with transparency

element.name: TSpeedButton
element.short: A Button used to represent states (checked or unchecked)

descr.p: The Speed Button is designed to automate a process when it is selected. An user pushes a button to start an action or set a mode.
When a user clicks on a SpeedButton focus is not shifted; a Speed Button never gets focus. The button may carry an descriptive glyph, and has a state (checked or not, etc).
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
The (default) action to be associated with this control.
Can either read the action already associated with the control (GetAction), or write an action to be associated (SetAction).
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign).
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determines how the control is to be anchored to its client or parent control.
Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored.

element.name: TSpeedButton.BidiMode
element.short: Indicates the bi-drectional text mode for the control

descr.p: Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determines the border spacing for this control.
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.
Gets caption as a text-string (GetText), or stores the new caption (SetText). Shows flag if caption is stored (IsCaptionStored).
By default, the Caption appears the same as the control Name in the Object Inspector, and the developer needs to set it explicitly to some new text.
The VCL implementation relies on the virtual Get/SetTextBuf to exchange text between widgets and VCL. This means a lot of (unnecessary) text copies.
The LCL uses strings for exchanging text (more efficient). To maintain VCL compatibility, the virtual RealGet/SetText is introduced. These functions interface with the LCLInterface.
The default Get/SetTextBuf implementation calls the RealGet/SetText. As long as the Get/SetTextBuf isn't overridden Get/SetText calls RealGet/SetText to avoid PChar copying.
To keep things optimal, LCL implementations should always override RealGet/SetText. Get/SetTextBuf is only kept for compatibility.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Reads the value for color, or stores the value, and sets a flag if the color is stored.
The default color is the same as the window in which the control is located.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Whether the control is Enabled. If not, it usually appears 'greyed-out'.
Reads a flag to see whether the control is enabled, or stores a new value. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.
Reads a flag to see what font should be used, or sets a flag to store it. If stored, sets a flag to say so.
The properties of Font are defined in the parent class TFont.

The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets, among others, Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use IsVisible method to consider this and get real visibility.

descr.p: Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants.

This is often the default action for many controls, and is often the ONLY action specified by the programmer. The action can be specified by the user, either by typing explicit code into the implementation section for this control, or by selecting an action from a pre-supplied ActionList.
Reads or writes a flag if a mouse click is detected, and sets a flag if a value is stored.

Double-clicking is much more common in a Windows environment than in Unix or Linux, where single-clicking is the default method for selecting an object. However, in all environments there could be valid use for a double-click, and a method should be supplied if appropriate.

Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants. Reads flag or writes one to determine if a hint is to be shown when mouse hovers over this control. If value is stored, a storage flag is set. Display of the actual hint is controlled by OnShowHint.

element.name: TSpeedButton.PopupMenu
element.descr: Standard properties, which should be supported by all descendants. Reads the details of the pop-up menu, or stores them. Properties are defined in the TPopupMenu parent class.

element.name: TGetDefaultBitBtnGlyph
element.short: TGetDefaultBitBtnGlyph - generic method to return a default Bit Button Glyph of specified Kind

element.name: GetLCLDefaultBtnGlyph
element.short: GetLCLDefaultBtnGlyph gets the LCL default button glyph for the specified button Kind

element.name: LoadGlyphFromResourceName
element.short: Loads a bitmap from a named resource into the specified Glyph

descr.p: LoadGlyphFromResourceName is a procedure used to load a bitmap into the specified Glyph from a named resource. AGlyph is the TButtonGlyph where the bitmap is stored. Instance is a THandle for the resource instance accessed in the routine. AName contains the name for the resource loaded in the routine.

LoadGlyphFromResourceName calls CreateBitmapFromResourceName to retrieve a TCustomBitmap using the specified handle and resource name. The bitmap is assigned to the TButtonGlyph in AGlyph. When AName is an empty string (''), the Glyph image in AGlyph is set to Nil.
LoadGlyphFromResourceName is used in the implementation of the LoadGlyphFromResourceName method in both TCustomBitBtn and TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: LoadGlyphFromResourceName.AGlyph
element.short: Button glyph updated in the routine

element.name: LoadGlyphFromResourceName.Instance
element.short: Handle for the resource

element.name: LoadGlyphFromResourceName.AName
element.short: Resource name loaded in the routine

element.name: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource
element.short: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource loads a glyph image with the specified name from a Lazarus Resource file (.lrs)

descr.p: Used in the implementation of the LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource method in both TCustomBitBtn and TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource.AGlyph
element.short: Class instance where the bitmap for the glyph is stored

element.name: LoadGlyphFromLazarusResource.AName
element.short: Resource name loaded in the routine

element.name: LoadGlyphFromStock
element.short: Loads the bitmap for the specified Glyph using the image for the specified button identifier
element.descr: LoadGlyphFromStock is a procedure used to load a TBitmap into the AGlyph argument with the image used for the button identifier in idButton. LoadGlyphFromStock calls the GetButtonIcon routine to load the graphic image for the button identifier. Used in the implementation of the LoadGlyphFromStock method in both TCustomBitBtn and TCustomSpeedButton.

element.name: LoadGlyphFromStock.AGlyph
element.short: TButtonGlyph where the bitmap is stored

element.name: LoadGlyphFromStock.idButton
element.short: Button identifier for the image loaded in the routine

element.name: GetButtonCaption
element.short: Gets the default caption for the specified button identifier

element.name: GetDefaultButtonIcon
element.short: Gets the default icon for the specified button identifier

element.name: GetButtonIcon
element.short: Gets a bitmap with the glyph image for the specified button identifier

descr.p: GetButtonIcon is a TCustomBitmap function used to get a bitmap with the glyph image for the button identifier in idButton. GetButtonIcon calls the GetStockImage routine in ThemeServices to get the handle used for the stock image. If the return value is False, the GetDefaultButtonIcon is called to get the icon for the button identifier.
GetButtonIcon is used in the implementation of the LoadGlyphFromStock routine.

element.name: BidiAdjustButtonLayout
element.short: Adjusts the specified button layout for use in bi-drectional rendering

element.name: dbgs
element.short: Gets a String with debugging information from the specified TBitBtnKind instance

element.name: dbgs.Result
element.short: Formatted string value with the information for the type

element.name: dbgs.Kind
element.short: TBitBtnKind instance examined in the routine

element.name: BitBtnModalResults
element.short: Contains modal result values for buttons defined in TBitBtnKind

descr.p: BitBtnModalResults is an Array constant which contains TModalResult values returned for buttons in TBitBtn. BitBtnModalResults is indexed by the enumeration values in TBitBtnKind. BitBtnModalResults is used in the implementation of the RealizeKind method in TCustomBitBtn.

element.name: BitBtnImages
element.short: Contains button identifiers used to get icons for TBitBtn button glyphs

descr.p: BitBtnImages is an Array constant which contains LongInt values for the button identifiers used in TBitBtn. BitBtnImages is indexed by the enumeration values in TBitBtnKind. Values in BitBtnImages are used in the GetLCLDefaultBtnGlyph routine.

element.name: BitBtnResNames
element.short: Contains resource names for corresponding button identifiers in TBitBtn

descr.p: BitBtnResNames is an Array constant that contains Strings with the resource name for button identifiers used in TBitBtn. Values in BitBtnResNames are indexed by the range of values defined in BitBtnImages as idButtonOk..idButtonNoToAll.
BitBtnResNames is used in the implementation of the RealizeKind method in TCustomBitBtn.

element.name: Register
element.short: Registers TBitBtn and TSpeedButton classes on the Additional tab in the Lazarus IDE
